Dear Mr. VanderLoon:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204- 6992.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4154 Shelter care and detention institutions; service plans.
• (1) Within 30 calendar days after admission and
every 15 calendar days thereafter, an institution
shall complete a written service plan. The
service plan shall include all of the following:
One of one treatment plan reviewed was completed one day late. The period
reviewed was from 12/18/23 through 1/18/24.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
period under review and the compliance with the CAP is as follows: The CAP was
for last year’s interim audit for not storing files appropriately, initial documentation
and discharge plans for youth missing required information. There were no special
investigations during the period under review. CAP monitoring was conducted
with the facility and the facility has complied with the CAP.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on review of the facility's budget
and agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator stated things at the facility are going well. The Chief
Administrator reported having an experienced group of staff with different levels of
experience that work well together and build off one another. The Chief
Administrator stated the youth placed benefit from staff being more consistent.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported a good working environment, feeling supported, the
youth having their needs met and overall enjoying their jobs and whom they work
with.
The youth interviewed stated he does not mind being at the facility. He reported
staff to be nice, engaging and having a structured schedule with clear
expectations.

Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on January 30, 2024.
The facility received a B rating on the environmental health inspection report. It
was noted the drain field was showing signs of failure. The facility had the septic
tank pumped on 01/09/2024 and once the snow melts will have the valve switched
to the second drain field.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
